titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts 1977.572
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T10:25-0500

did.unittitle: Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts
did.abstract: Original and Photostat copies of receipts issued by the Queens County Treasurer's Office from a public auction for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County owned by Charles H. Smith and seized for non-payment of taxes. The receipts date from 1892 to o1897.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction receipts, 1977.572, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
